oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1946-08-31 - Excerpts 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from August 31, 1946. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Red Foley (host/performer) and performers the Duke Of Paducah, Minnie Pearl, Mac McGar, the Old Hickory Singers, Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet, and Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Old Hickory Singers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Louie Buck introduces Red Foley -- I Hung My Head And Cried (Red Foley) -- [break] -- Red Foley introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Floatin' Down To Cotton Town (Old Hickory Singers) -- [break] -- Red Foley talks -- A Beautiful Home (Red Foley)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Duke of Paducah, 1901-1986; Minnie Pearl; McGar, Mac; Old Hickory Singers; Fowler, Wally; Oak Ridge Quartet; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group);
